content.description: Start low in the chalked up pocket. Head straight up to nice jugs then difficult pebbles as you work your way into an awkward top out. Using the boulder to your right lowers the difficulty quite a bit. Try to avoid it for the V3 problem.
content.protection: A crashpad and a good spotter.
content.location: This boulder is on the right side of the highest up cave. It is the last one along the trail that often has a small pool beside it.

content.description: Start on tiny crimps and the bottom of the protruding part of the rock. Head up or potentially up and left to top out.
content.location: This problem hangs over the trail.

content.description:
Start the same as

Flight Risk Stand

(left edge and right undercling). Make one move out right, then top out directly up the black streak.
content.protection: Pads and a spotter. It is not very tall, but the landing is a little uneven.
content.location:
Use the same start as

Flight Risk Stand

.

content.description: Start on a sidepull and crimp. Head up trusting small pebbles for your feet and for your hands. Top out up and left.
content.location: It is located on the trailside of the boulder that stands in front of the higher up caves.

content.description: Start on obvious crimps at shoulder height. Put your foot on a ledge underneath the cave, and do a big right hand move to a sloper.

Stand matched with a vertical slot under a cool but holdless left-facing feature that follows a seam going to the lip. Make a huge span to one of the pebbles at the lip, and then get creative with toehook beta or kneebar beta to finish under the tree at the summit.
content.location:
Begin left of

Flight Risk

in the larger opening of the roof above First Responder. First Responder is the sit start into Rapid Response and forces one to use a much more difficult sequence through Rapid Response. First Responder begins with a right hand "tooth" cobble and a left hand round cobble pinch using the ledge under/left for feet.

content.description:
This is an amazing arete just 20 yards past the Pandemic Cave on the main trail.

Video beta:

https://youtu.be/uII3eR2C84A

.
content.location: Start grabbing two buckets at about 7 feet height. Pull on, and climb the crimps to the sloping lip. Mantel. This is a little spooky.

content.description: Start on the chalked up jug under the cave roof. Campus movements out, up, and left lead to a dicey topout.
content.location: This boulder hangs over the main trail. You can't miss it.

content.description: High Risk is an easy highball problem. Stand start below the big protruding pebbles. Head straight up, and make sure to have a game plan for the topout.
content.protection: A crashpad or tw and God's intervention if you fall from the top.
content.location: This located on the tall wall before you reach the highest cave. It's directly left of the path. There are several other V0s on this wall.

content.description: Start on low conglomerate jug. Search for sharp pockets, and fight your way over the bulge to top out.
content.location: It is on the right side of the highest up cave.

content.description:
This line is so cool! Start with your right hand on the bottom part of the “Joe’s rail” and your left hand on the crimp rail. Do the “swarm” jump move, and finish via

Roofio

.

Beta video here:

https://youtu.be/tXw7HuAqNXg

.
content.location:
This is the stand start of

Flight Risk

.

content.description:
This is the amazing sit start to

Roofio

. Start on the amazing, black, horizontal rails under the crimp rail in the roof in the black streak. They look straight out of Joe’s Valley! Pull on using a solid, black cobble for your left and a right toe hook on another. Do a hard bump move to the right side of the crimp rail, and then do an amazing “swarm”-like rip to the starting crimp rail for

Roofio

. Finish as for

Roofio

. The true sit remains a project.
content.location:
Start just left of

Roofio

under the roof.

content.description: Start low on the two jugs. Head up to the first hueco then up right to the second hueco. The topout is pretty easy and on jugs after that.
content.location: This is on the left side of the last cave.

content.description:
Start in the larger part of the cave on two obvious holds at hip height with a huge heel out right. Do a hard left hand move to an undercling and another hard move to a sloping “eye” crimp. Set your feet, and bump right hand to the bucket lip. Match and top out.

Video beta:

https://youtu.be/eyEVJ5mlxCI

.
content.location: It is on the left side of the Pandemic Caves.

content.description: The 2nd Wave is a short and sweet problem. Start on the big ledge. Go up right potentially with a heel hook.
content.location: It is along the trail in the first part of Pandemic Caves.

pathTokens: Denver Metropolitan Area Bouldering and Buildering
